body:
OK so I've been playing and pvping since 2013, and every time i'm on avicus someone will kill me with one hit due to their knock back..... I've seen many tutorials on how to cause it but sprinting, hitting their legs, and even using Speed potions hasn't helped me at all. Do Not comment down here if you're going to have a salty opinion to this thread. Please someone reply to this, I'm just curious, and want to learn this technique.

   -Cyanide :D

replies.body:
^ Ignore him :P

What I usually do is to keep clicking, and spam my sprint button while diving at them and hitting them, causing them to fly backwards. Also, I've found that making my aim shake a little actually improves the knockback I'm getting.

Edit: arrow was pointing at Ducks.

replies.body:
Their are many ways of getting alot of knockback. The probably well known one is hitting him while in the air. There is also a less known one. Everytime you are starting a sprint the first hit will deal extra knockback, the others will give them normal knockback. What you can do is spamming W to reset your sprint. I would try to sync it to your click speed as iti is also a little bit of a gamble, cause if you are doing it wrong the enemy can easily get you into a combo. Another way is a strategy called hybrid blockhitting. What you have to do is hit the enemy, block once, hit, block .... Because of the blocking you are going to reset your sprint and deal extra knockback. This technique is way harder to learn but if you got it you can do god combos.

Sry if there is any miss information. I'm not the best.

reset sprint, and usually just click fast. Blockhitting helps 2, but 1.8 has no blockhitting =P.

You should REALLY learn to to kb REDUCE.

The best and easiest way is just to hold a and then d for like 1 sec. You can also jump and press s right b4 someone hits you. Thx Jg :3

replies.body:
I have three main ways I use to get knockback. 

tl;dr: Crouch, block-hit, and shake your head. 

Number one, it's important to understand that you get the highest knockback when you first start sprinting. You can take advantage of this to get some really amazing knockback. To do this, you must time your crouches. After you start sprinting, continue holding down the sprint button. Then, use your crouches to reset your sprint, making you start sprinting again, allowing you to get the best knockback. Once you get a lot of experience with it, you can start timing them to always get the highest amount possible. Also, crouching decreases knockback on you, making it even harder for your opponent to avoid getting knocked into the void. 

Secondly, don't be afraid to block-hit. This can be quite beneficial because it obviously decreases damage and-- correct me if I'm wrong-- can let you reach a bit farther, allowing you to get those few extra hits.

Thirdly, quickly shaking your head in a "condensed" manner, so to speak, is also a good idea. Maybe it's just me, but I've noticed when I quickly shake my mouse around in a small amount of my screen, I tend to get more knockback and hits.

Enjoy c;

replies.body:
Oh, yeah, since I assumed this post was made for information regarding Avicus PVP, I put this in because, after all, from my experience, it's one of the biggest factors that affects knockback. But yeah, I wouldn't recommend doing this in a 1v1, either :p

Also, I've done a lot of experimenting, and it definitely seems to me that shaking your head does, in fact, increase your knockback :I

P.S.
Your IQ remains relatively the same, regardless of age ._.

Yes, it is just a game. I'm sorry if I angered or offended you in any way; I was only trying to help SirCyanide by giving any information I knew about getting knockback on a server I've spent a lot of game time on. Once you have received the notification, you just click "Join Team" and you're in!

When vladthegreat100 gets back from his vacation, I'll ask him about it, since he's the owner.
:)

replies.body:
So many cringeworthy posts that are so incredibly inaccurate. I'm going to shed some light on this. And also help the OP. 
  
"is to kind of shake your mouse very slightly from side to side. "
I'm sorry what? That's not even how KB mechanics work. If you do it's either because you have 0-50ms (very good ms) or the 80-120ms, typically referred to as the "spanish knockback". Minecraft is one of the most ms based games out there and ping affects pvp skill so much. Also the reason why "ping warriors" don't take any KB. 

"blockhitting gives you more kb"
Myth. It barely gives you any KB and if someone is sending you flying it's either because they are hybrid blockhitting. (Or the ms range i mentioned previously) That's how you get insane reach usually. The only person I know that can execute this perfectly is Stan. 

"Jitterclicking gives you KB"
It gives you reach, not KB. If this was true then Dualzz would be sending people flying when circlestrafing. It's also not a requirement if you want to combo. If you're fucking over your aim just because of 1-2 extra clicks then don't do it. 
Also, there is no way to get good at pvp other than practicing. Play on Badlion ranked ladders and Kohi ladders, etc. Don't try to perform a certain playstyle, have people improve your current technique and you will develop your own unique pvp style. You will get good trust me. And use a sprint key if you aren't (it's 1.8 already for god's sake)
replies.body_tagged:

Minecraft is one of the most ms based games out there and ping affects pvp skill so much. Also the reason why "ping warriors" don't take any KB.

Also, there is no way to get good at pvp other than practicing. Play on Badlion ranked ladders and Kohi ladders, etc. Don't try to perform a certain playstyle, have people improve your current technique and you will develop your own unique pvp style. You will get good trust me. And use a sprint key if you aren't (it's 1.8 already for god's sake)

replies.body:
1. Head-Twitch: When aiming at the other players head, you won't knock them back but you will knock them a lot of blocks up.
2. W Spam: Just try spamming your W key when strafing and you'll get a lot of KB.
3. Abuse Lag: The hit detection gets somekind of delay when lagging producing more KB.
replies.body_tagged:
1. Head-Twitch: When aiming at the other players head, you won't knock them back but you will knock them a lot of blocks up.
2. W Spam: Just try spamming your W key when strafing and you'll get a lot of KB.
3. Abuse Lag: The hit detection gets somekind of delay when lagging producing more KB.

replies.body: W spam (it's called wobbling btw) only works if you time it right. The whole point of it is to re-engage your sprint to get the initial hit KB effect. However if you time it late you won't be sprinting when you engage your initial hit and it will fuck you over completely. time it too early and you won't get the effect. You don't need to wobble all the way when engaging in the combo itself.
replies.body_tagged: W spam (it's called wobbling btw) only works if you time it right. The whole point of it is to re-engage your sprint to get the initial hit KB effect. However if you time it late you won't be sprinting when you engage your initial hit and it will fuck you over completely. time it too early and you won't get the effect. You don't need to wobble all the way when engaging in the combo itself.
